days_from_incubation_to_infectious.longformDescription: The average number of days between a patient being infected and becoming infectious.

days_from_infectious_to_not_infectious.longformDescription: Average number of days a mildly ill patient is infectious, before they either recover or move to the hospital.

asymptomatic_infection_duration.longformDescription: The average number of days an asymptomatic person will be infectious. People who do not show symptoms may have different behavior because they most likely do not know they are infectious, so they may not take measures to isolate or otherwise reduce contact with susceptible people.

days_in_hospital.longformDescription: The average number of days a hospitalized patient stays in the hospital, before recovering or moving to the ICU.

icu_time_death.longformDescription: Average number of days in the ICU, before recovering or passing away.

hospitalization_rate.longformDescription: The percentage of mild infections who move to the hospital, where they have a different recovery rate, recovery duration, and transmission dynamics (they are still infectious, just at a separate rate). From the hospital people can either recover or go to the ICU. Note that asymptomatic people do not go to the hospital.

hospitalized_cases_requiring_icu_care.longformDescription: The percentage of hospitalized patients who go to the ICU, where they have a different recovery rate, recovery duration, and transmission dynamics (they are still infectious, just at a separate rate). Note that infected people always go to the hospital before being admitted to the ICU.

death_rate_for_critical.longformDescription: Percentage of ICU patients who do not recover; note that fatalities always go to the ICUâ€”this rate is separate from the Case Fatality Rate, which is computed and displayed based on the rates patients move through all stages of the model.

percentage_of_cases_asymptomatic.longformDescription: Percentage of all infectious people who do not show symptoms. If this is set to zero, asymptomatic cases will be removed from the model.

beta_asymp.description:
Inital transmission rate of asymptomatic cases
(people per day)
beta_asymp.longformDescription: The initial number of people an asymptomatic case is expected to infect per day, each day they remain infectious. As the susceptible population decreases, fewer people will actually be infected by each infectious person each day.

beta_mild.description:
Initial transmission rate of mild cases
(people per day)
beta_mild.longformDescription: The initial number of people a mild case is expected to infect per day, each day they remain infectious. As the susceptible population decreases, fewer people will actually be infected by each infectious person each day.

beta_hospitalized.description:
Initial transmission rate of hospitalized cases
(people per day)
beta_hospitalized.longformDescription: The initial number of people a hospitalized patient is expected to infect per day, each day they remain infectious. As the susceptible population decreases, fewer people will actually be infected by each infectious person each day.

beta_icu.description:
Initial transmission rate of ICU patients
(people per day)
beta_icu.longformDescription: The initial number of people an ICU patient is expected to infect per day, each day they remain infectious. As the susceptible population decreases, fewer people will actually be infected by each infectious person each day.

icu_capacity.longformDescription: This simply draws a horizontal line to help users visualize when ICU rate is exceeded. It only makes sense to draw this line under specific conditions. If you have trouble getting it visible, try to uncheck fatalities and infections, and then drag y axis zoom to a position where the line should be visible.

policyRampDays.longformDescription: The number of days before an intervention reaches full effect. The effectiveness of the policy each day before full effect is calculated according to a logistic function where the policy is half in effect halfway through the ramp-up period.
